com.github.xemiru.sponge.boxboy

Class Menu

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.xemiru.sponge.boxboy.Menu
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExtendedMenu

    public class Menu
extends Object
    A collection of Buttons presented as a user interface through the use of ItemStacks within a given Inventory.

    • Method Detail

      • isInvalidated

        public boolean isInvalidated()
        Returns whether or not this Menu is in an invalidated state -- i.e., the menu is waiting to have its representative inventory updated in the next tick to reflect changes made in the current.

        If this Menu contains any Buttons that are animated, this method will return based on the animation given by Button.getAnimatedRepresentative(). If an animation is present, the Menu is invalidated if Animation.isNewFrame() returns true. If no animation is present, the Menu is invalidated if Button.isAnimated() returns true. Otherwise, the Menu's own invalidation flag (which can be forced through invalidate()) is used.

        Returns:
        if this Menu is in an invalidated state

      • invalidate

        public void invalidate()
        Invalidates this Menu.
        See Also:
        isInvalidated()

      • getCapacity

        public int getCapacity()
        Returns the capacity of this Menu, i.e. how many Buttons can be held by it.

        This value is the upper exclusive limit of the getButton(int) and setButton(int, Button) methods.

        Returns:
        the capacity of this Menu

      • getButton

        public Optional<Button> getButton(int index)
        Returns the Button set at the given index?
        Parameters:
        index - the index to query
        Returns:
        the Button at the given index?

      • setButton

        public void setButton(int index,
                      Button button)
        Sets a Button in this menu, or clears the one at the given index if null.

        Menu contents are updated through invalidation flags checked by a recurring scheduler task; this method is thus safe to call during inventory events.

        Parameters:
        index - the index to set the Button at
        button - the Button to set, or null to clear

      • isViewingMenu

        public boolean isViewingMenu(Player player)
        Returns whether or not a given Player has this Menu open.
        Parameters:
        player - the Player to query
        Returns:
        if the given Player is currently viewing this Menu

      • getViewers

        public Set<UUID> getViewers()
        Returns the set of all UUIDs belonging to Players currently viewing this Menu.
        Returns:
        a set of UUIDs belonging to Players currently viewing this Menu

      • open

        public void open(Player player)
        Shows this Menu to the given Player.

        Note the sensitivity of inventory interactions when in response to inventory events. If this method is to be called as part of the response to an inventory event (e.g. during the calls to Button.onClick(ClickContext) or Button.offer(OfferContext)), it should be performed on the next possible tick through the scheduler.

        Parameters:
        player - the Player to show this Menu to

      • getInventory

        public Inventory getInventory()
        Returns the underlying inventory used by this Menu.
        Returns:
        the underlying inventory used by this Menu

      • updateInventory

        public void updateInventory()
        Updates the Inventory used by this Menu to display its buttons.

        The invalidation state is reset upon calling this method.

      • clearAnimations

        public void clearAnimations()
        Clears this Menu of any animations applied by AnimatedMenuPatterns, if any.
